page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT
page.content: In this location of mainly sea, cliffs and fields, employment is minimal. Such as there is, is mainly connected with Agriculture, Tourism and the Lifesaving services. Two farms each employ 2 men. One caravan site runs in conjunction with a farm, by its owner family; a second employs 6 (mainly summer only.) A Toll Gate on the Trevose Head Road gives summer employment to 2 ladies. One Hotel is run without staff by its two owner families; a second, with carvery restaurant and holiday chalets, employs up to 40 in high season. Three (summer only) shops within tourist establishments, providing up to 10 summer jobs. The RNLI Lifeboat employs fulltime paid employment for two persons - coxswain and mechanic. One paid Coastguard for whole sector. Four Lighthouse keepers.
